candidates.title: Bump h2 from 0.3.15 to 0.3.16

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [h2](https://github.com/hyperium/h2) from 0.3.15 to 0.3.16.
Release notes

Sourced from h2's releases.

v0.3.16

What's Changed

  • Set Protocol extension on requests when received Extended CONNECT requests.
  • Remove B: Unpin + 'static bound requiremented of bufs
  • Fix releasing of frames when stream is finished, reducing memory usage.
  • Fix panic when trying to send data and connection window is available, but stream window is not.
  • Fix spurious wakeups when stream capacity is not available.

New Contributors

  • @​vi made their first contribution in hyperium/h2#646
  • @​silence-coding made their first contribution in hyperium/h2#651
  • @​gtsiam made their first contribution in hyperium/h2#649
  • @​howardjohn made their first contribution in hyperium/h2#658
  • @​cloneable made their first contribution in hyperium/h2#655
  • @​aftersnow made their first contribution in hyperium/h2#657
  • @​vadim-eg made their first contribution in hyperium/h2#661
Changelog

Sourced from h2's changelog.

0.3.16 (February 27, 2023)

  • Set Protocol extension on requests when received Extended CONNECT requests.
  • Remove B: Unpin + 'static bound requiremented of bufs
  • Fix releasing of frames when stream is finished, reducing memory usage.
  • Fix panic when trying to send data and connection window is available, but stream window is not.
  • Fix spurious wakeups when stream capacity is not available.
Commits
  • b9dcd39 v0.3.16
  • 96caf4f Add a message for EOF-related broken pipe errors (#615)
  • 7323190 Avoid spurious wakeups when stream capacity is not available (#661)
  • 73bea23 fix: panic in when there is connection window available, but not stream (#657)
  • b84c244 Add Protocol extension to Request on Extended CONNECT (#655)
  • 68e4403 Consistently indicate malformed in logs (#658)
  • 07d20b1 Fix all clippy warnings (#652)
  • c1ce37e Remove unnecessary Unpin + 'static bounds on body (#649)
  • af47a08 fix issue#648: drop frame if stream is released (#651)
  • 294000c Fix docs of enable_push (#646)
  • See full diff in compare view

Release notes

Sourced from prost-derive's releases.

v0.11.8

PROST! is a Protocol Buffers implementation for the Rust Language. prost generates simple, idiomatic Rust code from proto2 and proto3 files.

  • Made ArgPredicate non_exhaustive

  • (derive) Hide some nightly clippy warnings

Fixes

  • (help) Don't show long help for --help just because hidden possible values include a description

[4.1.5] - 2023-02-15

Fixes

  • (help) Don't show long help for --help just because a hidden arg has a possible value with a description

  • (help) Respect disable_colored_help when using arg_required_else_help

candidates.title: Bump test-case from 2.2.2 to 3.0.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [test-case](https://github.com/frondeus/test-case) from 2.2.2 to 3.0.0.
Release notes

Sourced from test-case's releases.

Test Case - v3.0.0

Overview

This crate provides the #[test_case] procedural macro attribute that generates multiple parametrized tests using one body with different input parameters. A test is generated for each data set passed in the test_case attribute. Under the hood, all test cases that share the same body are grouped into a mod, giving clear and readable test results.

Changes

  • Split out test-case-core crate, allowing easier reuse in external crates. By @​evforde

IMPORTANT

Starting with the 3.0 release, we are changing test-case MSRV policy. We no longer can maintain our goal of only bumping MSRV with major SemVer releases partly due to how fast rust landscape changes and partly to how the rest of the rust ecosystem prefers instead not to keep MSRV breakage treated as SemVer breakage, making stricter policies hard to maintain with limited resources we have. The current goal is to support up to 3 of the latest stable releases. We hope that with this change, we'll be able to speed up test-case's maintenance processes and add more features in the coming months.

Changelog

Sourced from test-case's changelog.

3.0.0

[IMPORTANT] Starting with 3.0 release we are changing test-case MSRV policy to support only 3 latest stable releases.

Changes

  • Split out functional parts of test-case-macros crate into test-case-core for easy reuse by external libraries

Bumps [cc](https://github.com/rust-lang/cc-rs) from 1.0.78 to 1.0.79.

Sourced from cc's releases.

1.0.79

Version 1.0.79

Changelog

  • The riscv32imc-esp-espidf target is now supported (#776)
  • Build::is_flag_supported now checks the exit status of the compiler in addition to stderr output, improving reliability (#757)
  • When building for the aarch64-apple-ios-sim target -arch arm64 is now correctly passed as two arguments instead of one (#759)
  • Improved control over ar and ranlib (#763)
    • New functions to return the ar (Build::get_archiver) and ranlib (Build::get_ranlib) binaries used for this build have been added.
    • Several related environment variables involving the archiver and ranlib variant (ARFLAGS, RANLIBFLAGS, AR, and RANLIB) are now respected automatically if not overridden.
    • Some other changes too, see #763 for details.
  • We will now correctly locate msbuild under VS2022 (#773)

Additionally, a number of smaller changes which shouldn't impact users have been made (in particular #769 and #777); see the commit history for complete details.

Thanks to everybody who contributed to this release!

candidates.title: Bump windows from 0.42.0 to 0.44.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [windows](https://github.com/microsoft/windows-rs) from 0.42.0 to 0.44.0.
Release notes

Sourced from windows's releases.

0.44.0

As a reminder, updates are only published by request (#2279). This release does not include an update to the windows-sys crate, which remains stable and unchanged.

This is the first update to the windows crate in 3 months. As such, there are quite a few improvements and fixes. Some notable changes to take a look at:

  • There is now a getting started guide
  • Support for raw-dylib (#2164) - thanks @​dpaoliello!
  • A number of new samples have been added
  • The target lib files are now validated for changes (#2132)
  • Windows Runtime metadata has been updated to introduce new APIs for Windows 11 (#2192)
  • Win32 metadata has been updated with numerous fixes (#2247)
  • There's a new windows-targets crate that simplifies taking a dependency on the Windows libs (#2158)
  • Support for infallible return values (#2248)
  • Option to use default metadata for code generation (#2253)

Changes

  • Fix new clippy warnings by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2121
  • Add performance counter samples by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2120
  • Use more readable formatting for samples by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2124
  • Add DirectComposition sample by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2129
  • Remap D3DMATRIX to Matrix4x4 by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2130
  • Validate baseline for lib files by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2132
  • Update the win32 metadata to version 37.0.34 by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2133
  • Simplify yml build files by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2134
  • Don't require files for reading/writing by @​Jake-Shadle in microsoft/windows-rs#2131
  • Test DEVMODEA/DEVMODEW struct sizes are correct by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2139
  • Simplify extern function code generation by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2148
  • Introduce link macro to provide an abstraction over the Rust link attribute by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2152
  • Simplify yml generation by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2157
  • Add windows-targets crate to simplify lib dependency management by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2158
  • Improve samples and tests for validating calling conventions by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2159
  • Switch debugger visualizer from crate feature to build option by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2160
  • Streamline delay load core implementation by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2162
  • Remove deprecated WinRT namespaces by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2165
  • Update the win32 metadata to version 38.0.19 by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2166
  • Add optional support for raw-dylib by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2164
  • Generate field comparisons directly by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2168
  • Add device watcher sample by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2172
  • Test lower MSRV for windows-sys by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2173
  • Ensure bindings are warning-free by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2174
  • Detect unsupported trailing array parameters by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2178
  • Test readme by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2179
  • Update LLVM (MinGW) toolchain by @​riverar in microsoft/windows-rs#2163
  • Downgrade target crates versions to 0.42.1 by @​glandium in microsoft/windows-rs#2183
  • Update Windows metadata by @​riverar in microsoft/windows-rs#2192
  • Direct3D12 sample - fix copy_nonoverlapping size by @​damyanp in microsoft/windows-rs#2195
  • Exclude major COM APIs from the windows-sys crate by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2194
  • verbatim modifier is now stable by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2199
  • Update Win32 metadata by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2198
  • Simplify parameter binding code gen by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2202

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 6f115da Version 0.44.0 (#2279)
  • 7c65c07 Add Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) sample (#2277)
  • 1bfd409 Update readme.md
  • 59950e2 Verify alignment for DEVMODEA/DEVMODEW structs (#2271)
  • a8b3b38 Organize samples into folders (#2270)
  • 53108ea Update metadata readme (#2267)
  • 754b838 Include doc comment for GUID constants (#2268)
  • 75a8260 Add fallible allocations and string conversions (#2254)
  • 442fd8b Provide option to use default metadata for code generation (#2253)
  • 0ee7be0 Infallible return values and more efficient out parameters (#2248)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view
